text.section: There is a Maryland Fire-Rescue Education and Training Commission in the Maryland Higher Education Commission.

section.section: Each member serves for a term of 4 years and until a successor is appointed and qualifies. These terms are staggered as required by the terms of the members serving on July 1, 1978.
A member appointed to fill a vacancy in an unexpired term serves only for the remainder of that term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

A member may be removed by the Governor:
For neglect of duty; or
If the Governor believes the member's continued membership is not in the public interest.

Each member of the Commission:
Serves without compensation; but
Is entitled to reimbursement for expenses in accordance with the Standard State Travel Regulations.
The Governor shall designate one of the members of the Commission as the chairman of the Commission. The chairman serves at the pleasure of the Governor.
Each year, the Commission shall elect a vice chairman and any other officer it requires.

The Commission:
Shall meet at least once every 2 months;
May meet at any other time the chairman designates; and
May adopt rules for the conduct of its meetings.
A quorum consists of 7 members, one of whom shall be the chairman or vice chairman.
